title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Valparaiso University
Interview Descriptions: I was surprised by how intense the interview process was. I interview via Zoom, then again on-campus. The on-campus interview was a full day. I interviewed with the department leadership and then the team. The interview process included a campus tour. It was incredibly well-rounded and thorough.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Valpo?

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and nice. The interviewer was nice and it was an open conversation and flexible. It was a good conversation and I felt comfortable to ask questions and change scheduling
Interview Questions: What is your availability during the year?

title: Solutions Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I did a standard 30-minute phone interview, an in-person interview (with everyone masked and distancing), and a remote technical interview. Everything was standard, and the people I spoke with were professional, kind and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Describe a project you worked on and what your contributions were.

title: Athletic Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Valparaiso University in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a very quick and easy process. They called me the day after I applied and set up the first interview by the end of the week. My second interview was then the following week and I heard back a couple days later with their decision.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5-10 years?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN)
Interview Descriptions: It was a two day process.  Meeting with Administration (Dean of College, Associate Provost), Department Chairs, and staff.  A presentation of pedagogical theories and beliefs- lunches, dinners with broader community.  It was well organized and accommodating.
Interview Questions: Thoughts on working in a faith based institution- primarily Lutheran.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Valparaiso University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very fun interview had to talk to a lot of people. It was fast paced and you had to work with other people that were also applying to the role. some role-playing as well

title: Peer Minister Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is a three step interview process, in which they try to gauge how you will react to situations, or you good in interacting with new students etc. It is a Christian institution but they accept people from all ethnicities.
Interview Questions: How  you think it means to be a Peer Minister?

title: Gift Advancement Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Applied in person. Spoke over the phone with an associate, then was brought in to meet with managing director and other colleagues. Mostly asking questions about sales ability and scenarios regarding persistence and rejection. Not terribly difficult interview. Process took about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you react to being rejected?

title: Graduate Writing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: They had me edit a paper before the actual interview to see how I interacted with student texts. Interview itself was pretty simple and laid back. We had more of a conversation about my experience and how I planned to utilize my degree in the center than a typical question and answer type interview.
Interview Questions: How can you improve the writing center experience?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Valparaiso University
Interview Descriptions: I only met with my future supervisor for 10 minutes. The rest of the interview was spent with a colleague who told me personal stories of her life. I only talked about the job for 30 minutes over lunch, and I offered ideas to current problems. Very few questions asked about work scenarios, experience, or work ethic.
Interview Questions: How would you feel if you were asked to teach Digital Literacy?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy interview. I was referred by an employee and met with the recruiter who described the job description in detail to me so there was no misunderstanding. I was contacted three days later and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with the job description?

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: its all about reliability, punctuality and strength to do the job. As long as your classes do not conflict with your work and you have enough spare time to work within 19-20 hrs per week and you are qualify then you good to work.

title: Admission Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Valparaiso University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very organized and included many different leaders and counselors. I was able to ask questions I had about the position and received straight forward responses from the group.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Valpo?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Valparaiso University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very organized and included many different leaders and counselors. I was able to ask questions I had about the position and received straight forward responses from the group.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Valpo?

title: Financial Aid Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Valparaiso University
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews - 1. Phone 2. In Person w/administration 3. In Person w/department personnel
Interview Questions: Great pains made to determine if I would "fit" into the culture.

title: Library Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Valparaiso University (Valparaiso, IN) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was the interviewer.  She asked various questions. Since it is a student position, no previous experience is required. Questions relating to your personality and how you work with other people were asked. As long as you act presentable and show what kind of personality you have, the interview should go great.
Interview Questions: What was one hard moment in your life?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Valparaiso University in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
The entire process was quite long.  Here are the steps I followed to successfully get the job:

1) Applied to job opening view the university website by providing my resume, cover letter, and list of professional references.
2) Got a call for a preliminary phone interview with my direct supervisor
3) Scheduled for an in-person interview that lasted 4 hours with managers and staff
4) Scheduled for another in-person interview with Vice President of department to ensure I was the right fit
5) Got an email confirming that I had received the job! :)

The interview process was very long but that is because Valparaiso University wants to bring in the right candidate to grow the university.  It shows how much they care about the quality of their staff and faculty members.
Interview Questions: You haven't worked in higher education before, how do you think your skills will benefit Department X of Valparaiso University?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Valparaiso University in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Standard academic interview. 2-3 days, teaching demo, meetings with department & administration. Well organized, standard accommodations. Good meals - many good non-chain restaurants in the town. Teaching demos vary by department. The dept I interviewed with asks that the applicant teach his research to a class of undergrads; tricky, because you have to make it accessible to undergrads, while giving enough detail for the faculty.
Interview Questions: "Are you Lutheran?" (Yes, they can legally ask this; it is a Lutheran organization.)
